item.title: General Relativity
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Joachim Weise)
item.description: Mathematics of Curved Spacetime Differentiable Manifolds: Defining an abstract manifold as a space consisting of patches that look locally like the Euclidean space and are smoothly sewn together. Introducing functions and curves on manifolds. Tangent Spaces: Defining tangent vectors as derivations, or directional derivative operators acting on functions along curves. The set of tangent vectors a point \(p\) of a manifold has the structure of a vector space under addition and scalar multiplication.
